group_1.narration: The next kanji we need to write@“giving it your all” 「全力投球」 is the “throw” 「投」 kanji.@So, we solved the hint and went to that place.

group_1.textLeft: Huuh?!@So this isn't the place?!
But...

group_1.narration: Hint…@Here you can play the game where you “roll” 「転」@balls without “throwing” 「投」 them!

group_1.textLeft: We came here thinking the answer was a@bowling alley…

group_1.textRight: But the hint that was set for here was...

group_1.narration: Hint…@No matter if you're a “child” 「子」 or an adult,@the “complete” 「熟」 family can have fun here!

group_1.textRight: …So that's it.
We got the cards, but they're not the ones@we wanted.

group_1.textLeft: The “child” 「子」 and the “complete” 「熟」@kanji.
If a bowling alley wasn't the correct answer,@then what was it?

group_1.textRight: “Rolling the ball without throwing it”…@Soccer? Indoor soccer?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, billiards?

group_1.textRight: It could be any of those...

group_1.textLeft: There’s very little time left, should we@look for the other kanji?

group_1.textRight: Good idea.

group_1.textLeft: We're trying to form “giving it your all” 「全力投球」,@so the only one left is the “strength” 「力」 kanji.

group_1.textRight: It seems that we can get that kanji from@a restaurant in Hokuyo Ward.
Understood!@Here are three lunch boxes.

group_1.textLeft: Oh…
Ria...?

group_1.textRight: Wow, I never thought I would meet you here again.
More than anything, you remember me…@That makes me happy.

group_1.textLeft: I-I wouldn't forget you.
(She's...too intense....to forget.)

group_1.textRight: What's wrong, Madoka?

group_1.textLeft: Are you sure this is the place, Homura?

group_1.textRight: The locals we asked all think it is...

group_1.textLeft: I think this is the only obvious restaurant@in Hokuyo Ward.

group_1.narration: Hint…@Eat here to stay healthy and “strong” 「力」!@Our “meat” 「肉」 meals are the best around.

group_1.textLeft: You are a model aren’t you, Ria?@Is it okay to eat meat for lunch?

group_1.textRight: That's true...it doesn't seem right...
Sorry for the wait!
Our most popular dish! Fluffy omurice!

group_1.textLeft: …Huh?@This doesn't have any meat…
Excuse me, are there any kanji cards here?

group_1.textRight: Of course!@Here they are.

group_1.textLeft: …The “half” 「半」 and “sphere” 「玉」 kanji…@Why?

group_1.textRight: Isn’t this what you were looking for?
You came here because of the hint, right?

group_1.textLeft: Yes…uhm, what was the hint for this store?

group_1.textRight: Let's see...

group_1.narration: Hint…@Fluffy of eggs and crunchy onion “spheres” 「玉」.@Our special omurice is not “half” 「半」 bad!

group_1.textLeft: That's…
We got two cards, but…they weren't the ones@we were looking for.

group_1.textRight: It’s still too soon to give up! Is there@a word that we can make with these?
Uhm…
Plus the “child” 「子」 and the@“complete” 「熟」 cards, so..
Maybe...“half-boiled egg” 「半熟玉子」...

group_1.textLeft: That’s quite a unique New Year's calligraphy.

group_1.textRight: I don’t think...we are gonna win if we@pick that word.

group_1.textLeft: Maybe we could win the “weirdest word@award” if we go with that...?

group_1.textRight: …Huh?
Are you participating in the New Year’s@calligraphy rally?

group_1.textLeft: Uhm, yes…that’s right.

group_1.textRight: Can you show me the hint?

group_1.textLeft: Sure.
The kanji we are looking for are the@“strength” 「力」 and “throw” 「投」 kanji…

group_1.textRight: …Oh, I get it.

group_1.narration: Hint…@A place where everyone “throws” 「投」 away their health@and picks up a “spoon” 「匙」.

group_1.textRight: It’s a place called “Esther.”

group_1.textLeft: Esther...@Thank you!

group_1.textRight: I’m just doing my job as your senpai.

group_1.textLeft: That's surprising...!
Now that I think about it...@Aren't you a model, Ria-senpai?

group_1.textRight: Somehow, I don't think that was a compliment...
Esther… It's in Sakae Ward,@so it's kind of far.

group_1.textLeft: But it seems that the “strength” 「力」@kanji is near there too.
I would be great if we could find both...
Then let’s go to Sakae Ward!

group_1.textRight: Good luck!
We look forward to your next visit!
